pylossmap.utils.uniquify(iterable)[source]¶

Makes the entries in a list unique.

Parameters

iterable (Iterable) – list to uniquify, duplicates will have “_{number}” added to them.

Yields

str – uniquified element of iterable

pylossmap.utils.to_datetime(ts)[source]¶

Epoch time to datetime.

Parameters

ts (int/float) – Epoch or Unix time.

Returns

pd.Timestamp instance in Europe/Zurich timezone.

Return type

pd.Timestamp

pylossmap.utils.fill_from_time(t, fuzzy_t='12H')[source]¶

Gets the machine fill of a timestamp.

Parameters

  • t (int/float/str) – Epoch/Unix time or timestamp string.

  • fuzzy_t (str, optional) – pd.Timedelta format string. Controls the look back and look forward around “t” when looking for the fill.

Returns

dict containing the start/end time of the fill and with beam mode info.

Return type

dict

Raises

ValueError – if not fill is found.

pylossmap.utils.get_ADT(t1, t2, planes=['H', 'V'], beams=[1, 2], include=['amp', 'length', 'trigger'])[source]¶

Gets ADT blowup trigger data for the requested time interval, beam and plane.

Parameters

  • t1 (Datetime) – start of interval.

  • t2 (Datetime) – end of interval.

  • planes (list, optional) – requested planes.

  • beams (list, optional) – requested beams.

  • include (list, optional) – list of ADT metrcis to fetch from timber.

  • be a key of ADT_META. (Must) –

Returns

DataFrame as index the timestamp and columns the triggers of the beams/planes.

Return type

DataFrame
